I love this game to its core. Half-Life is one of my favourite games of all time. It's an excellent fps that does a fantastic job taking the player into it's world with a great selection of weapons, monsters and an overall outstanding atmosphere. It has aged quite ungracefully interms of graphics as the game was released way back in 1998 but the ai, music, atmosphere and gameplay still hold up very well. If you want to experience a fun, scary and action packed fps play this game! If I had any problems with it (not even things I find to be too much of a problem as I am a fanboy of this game) it would be that it may not always be clear to new players what exactly they should be doing in the story or overall goal. Alot of the more in depth stuff you will only find by searching up wikis about the story. It doesn't bother me but I can imagine it being confusing to newer players. It's told in a much more subtle fashion than some players might expect.

This game also has a huge libary of mods and addons. Games like conterstrike, day of defeat, team fortress and others wouldn't exist today if it wasn't for this game. Developers are still creating mods for this 18 year old game which I find amazing. 

BTW if you're gonna play this game, play it in the dark alone. Half-Life is more of an experience than a game you play with your friends although it does have multiplayer in the form of deathmatch (and other mods such as sven coop) I find the best way of playing it and enjoying it a first time is to play alone.

It's really hard to say something about Half-Life that hasn't already been said before. The game has been showered with such praise and acclaim since it's inception, even in the modern day. While many people would be ready to just write it off as people looking at it through 'nostalgia goggles', it's really important to go back and look at what makes it such a masterpiece.

Half-Life begins in a way that no other shooter at the time had done. Instead of leading off with a mission briefing before throwing you into a room full of demons, or showing you a cutscene to serve as exposition, the game immediately puts you in the shoes of Dr. Gordon Freeman on his fated tram ride as he is late to work. Your control of Freeman is, well, free, and you're free to move about the tram and examine the surroundings of your tram. You, the player, help Freeman get into his HEV Suit, greet his colleagues, and push a specimen of crystal into a large machine which promptly wrecks the facility of Black Mesa. Gordon, with your aid, sets out on an epic quest to escape his workplace, fighting off freakish aliens and later on soldiers who are sent in to perform a cover-up operation. Only in one instance is direct control ever taken away from you and even then you see the event unfold through Freeman's eyes. Story isn't told to you via exposition, but rather by carefully placed scripted events and NPC's you can encounter who inform you of where to go next.

Half-Life's story, or rather the way it tells it's story still manages to be as immersive as it was when I first played it, way back in 2009. Gordon isn't some lunkheaded badass space marine who rips and tears the guts of his enemies but rather a normal person who just happens to be donning a powerful suit of experimental armor that prevents him from the same type of swift deaths that his co-workers are so subjected to. Black Mesa isn't a laid out level filled with awkward enemy traps that forces you to run around looking for arbitrary keycards to progress but rather a research facility that feels real and legitimate to go through, and it's still one of the most believable enviroments in a shooter today. The way the enemies interact with their environment makes them feel like actual living beings.

Of course, all of this wouldn't be anywhere near as good if the gameplay wasn't there as well. Thankfully, the combat in Half-Life is as visceral as other FPS games of it's time, featuring a wide array of weapons with meaty sound effects. Gordon's first weapon is his Iconic crowbar, which you wont be using so much as a weapon later on and more of as a 'hand' so to speak, it'll be the weapon you use to smash apart the environment to see what is and what isn't breakable, or to smash open a crate to gain supplies. Your ranged arsenal is very diverse, featuring basic weapons like a Submachine Gun, a Shotgun, and a Revolver to the Tau cannon, something akin to a wind up rail gun from quake, to a tranqulizer dart crossbow that you'll primarily be using to fight off underwater and aerial threats.

The weapons themselves are great but what makes them so fun to use is the fact that the enemies are just as diverse and require different strategies to take down. Something like a headcrab should be killed with the crowbar or the glock so as to not waste ammo, but faster, stronger moving targets like the HECU marines will be more easily dispatched with weapons like the MP5 or the Spas-12. You'll even come accross a giant hulking alien which is imperveous to all types of damage except for explosions. The sound designs on all the enemies is spot on, with the HECU sounding suitably intimidating over the radio comms, or the eerie roars of the Gargantua. 

This already solid gameplay is also helped by various other factors, like level design. I already mentioned that Black Mesa feels like a real place, and so the Level Design is often in close quarters, with enemies often hiding around corners and enemies like the HECU marines will take advantage of the various routes they can take to flank you, just as you are able to do the same. The game also features in my opinion one of the best VGM soundtracks out there, with songs like "Diabolical Adrenaline Guitar", "Nuclear Mission Jam", and the Credits theme standing out as some of my favorites in particular. When the soundtrack wants you to feel like a badass, it will, and when it wants to be atmospheric, it will. Valve's sound team was absolutely on point here, as the game and it's various sound effects, quotes and music all feel spot on.

Half-Life isn't without a few flaws here and there though.  The game slows down towards the middle, with two chapters On a Rail and Residue Processing feeling a little tedious to play through, and with the final levels of Xen outside of the final boss being incredibly annoying and un-fun to play through. It seems like there was some pact between FPS devs of the time to make the final levels of their games to be as stupid as possible, but even then I really don't think these are enough to truly hurt the game. Half-Life is remembered so fondly not just because of itself as a game, but also the way it revolutionized the Genre. So many other FPS games tried to follow in it's wake, and it still remains one of the most influential FPS games of all time.

Half-Life is without a doubt one of my personal favorite games of all time, as well in my opinion being worthy of being called one of the best games of all time. Half-Life is a game that combines an unbroken narrative with kick-ass gameplay, strong and realistic level design with a rockin' soundtrack to create one of the most celebrated games ever created. I didn't even touch upon the huge collection of high-quality free mods available for the game, but they absolutely exist. They Hunger, Afraid of Monsters and Poke646 stand out as some of my favorite mods for any game. Half-Life is absolutely worth your time and money, and you owe it to yourself to play it if you consider yourself a video game enthusiast.

Раньше, когда игровая индустрия только развивалась, люди пытались сделать что-то хорошее, шикарное; делали все только для развитие индустрии, не из-за корыстных побуждений; каждая игра создавалась с душой, не просто было их делать, это большой труд. Возможности сделать красивейшую графику не было, ведь это только начало, и поэтому вкладывались в сюжет, который многим людям и по сей день вспоминается с теплом и улыбкой на лице. Началось развитие мультиплеерных игр, они находятся на новом уровне игровой индустрии, им уделяют больше внимания, так как это выгоднее разработчикам. К чему выпускать игру которая поднимает прибыль не на долгое время, если можно сделать мультиплеер-игру которая будет ежедневно её приносить? 
Смотришь на то, когда вышла последняя часть в серии Half-Life, и думаешь "Почему? Столько ожиданий, столько времени прошло, так и ничего не произошло", от этих мыслей иногда даже ком в горле встает.

I wanted to like this game, I really did. I heard it was a classic. However, I feel like the main problem with the game is that it pulls a lot of cheap deaths on you.

Have you ever played I Wanna Be The Guy? You know, that game that likes to randomly kill you before you have time to react? That's how Half-Life feels. Explosions come out of nowhere and blow you up constantly, sometimes you have to just book it through tons of enemies, and sometimes the map layout was so twisty and confusing I had no idea where to go.

Not to mention you can play the whole game for free through Sven Co-op so...

EDIT (so people will stop yelling at me): THIS IS MY OPINION. MINE. NOT YOURS. ME NOT LIKING THIS GAME DOES NOT DETRACT FROM YOUR ENJOYMENT OF IT.

While playing this, I couldn't help but to make constant comparisons to original Doom.  Whereas Doom is no doubt the classic staple of the First-Person Shooter genre (see my in-depth review), this is in may ways a vastly superior experience in terms of rich, engaging, and seemless storytelling.  Both games follow a similar plot: Our protagonist is an agent of a Goverment-funded research facility doing things they should not be doing; something goes awry; all Hell breaks loose; fighting to survive we get transported to a different dimension; beat the big baddie; and save the universe.. for now... 

However, Doom is a collection of loosely interrelated levels ultimately culminating in a story arc showcasing our doomed (haha, get it?!) space marine's descent into the bowels of Hell, highlighted by expository text at the end of each episode, Half-Life is a fluid and constant narrative one experiences through the eyes of the protagonist - generally free of immersion-breaking cut scenes - no #@%&ing QTE's here! - sequences requiring the player to react play out in real time.  There's no level-end screens, but rather chapter titles appearing on screen as you progress through the different areas, letting the player know they are on the right track.  All part of the cohesive storytelling that keeps the player engaged right to the end.

The gameplay can be challenging, and at times, unforgiving.  The difficulty curve ramps up nicely as the player aqcuire better weapons, but ammunition can be sarce at times, which adds a good balance to the game. The visuals and voice acting are decent given the times, but the script is solid. 

 All in all: Great game. 2/3 ;)

[b]Intro[/b]
I don't like using the words 'overrated' and 'underrated', but I'm going to be hypocritical here and call this game, by FAR, the MOST OVERRATED game I've EVER played. I cannot fathom how or why this game gets so much praise. ALL of the praise I hear this game get I can give to another far superior game that came out
in the same year or even earlier. It's a glitch riddled, overly linear, somewhat dull FPS that overshadowed far more interesting and enjoyable titles of the year. 

[b]The Great:[/b]
++Fighting the human enemies (HCE marines) is a lot of fun
++AI is incredibly smart, not just for its time, but for now too
++Lots of enemy variety
++Soundtrack is fantastic
++Brilliant mod support

[b]The Good:[/b]
+Headshots are satisfying
+Weapons are diverse
+There are nice optional HD models
+Game supports ultra high resolutions by default
+Sound design is very good even if the actual quality is low
+Often impressive set pieces, the one place where this game actually did innovate, except fans of the game praise it for the very things they despise about CoD?

[b]The Okay/Not Too Big of a Deal:[/b]
+-Story? What story? Oh, you mean how there's occassional dialogue given by NPC's (that is, if it doesn't cut short for no reason) every once in a while? Come on, there's hardly a story other than an experiment went wrong, aliens invaded, then marines were sent to kill everyone involved with the project. Now, escape! Riveting stuff..
-+Gordon Freeman is mute and has very backstory. Not sure how a boring scientist can take on hundreds of highly trained marines either, as well as massive aliens.
+-Multiplayer is average

[b]The Bad:[/b]
-Short game
-Movement SUCKS. It feels like I'm roller skating and jump crouching as well as the air control movement feels off
-A good few weapons are straight up useless
-Some enemy types, especially towards the end, are REALLY not fun to fight
-Game is often praised for its atmosphere, but to me it's like a cheesy B-movie. All atmosphere is lost when dialogue is always cut short and when I see a scientist jump through a window, running away from zombies only to greet me and say "Greetings!" over enthusiastically.
-Field of view is awfully small and there's no slider
-The 5 minute long tram ride is a slow, dull showcase of uninteresting environments and has zero interactivity, and neither does the 10 minute intro after
-Hitboxes suck
-Has really bad screen tearing, no matter the frame rate
-Audio quality is poor
-Horrible animations
-No reason to play this again with no other game modes, a dead multiplayer community and no bots and a short campaign

[b]The Horrible:[/b]
--Level design is shoddy and often not a lot of fun to explore. It also makes no sense. Who puts meat grinders in a scientific research facility?
--The Hard difficulty isn't fun since it just turns enemies into bullet sponges. Two direct shotgun blasts and a grenade should kill a bullsquid, as should two direct shotgun blasts to a marine's torso...
--Game looks laughably bad, even in comparison to other poorer looking titles of the year
--Game goes from too easy to too hard in the last few chapters. One of the worst difficulty spikes I've ever felt.
--Gunplay is unsatisfying (besides headshots) and weapons feel dull. It's not awful, just very much below average.
--Buggy beyond belief. I cannot think of a single other game that I can manage to glitch out irrepairably within the first 10 seconds of gameplay... 'gameplay' being a word used loosely as you sit in a square 'room' with nothing to do. And this is after 2 decades of constant patches...

Sound: 6/10
Graphics: 3/10
Gameplay: 4/10
Content/Replayability: 2/10
Overall: 4/10 (Based on my overall enjoyment of the game)
Average: 4/10 (The four main categories added together, divided and rounded up)

[b]Conclusion[/b]
1998 is my favourite year for gaming. Half-Life is not a reason why. In-fact, it's almost a point against it. What a shame that other innovative titles had their trophies stolen by a far lesser game. If you must play this game in some form, play Black Mesa.

Half-Life is not only the most influential and important FPS ever made, it's also the best. The game excels at both combat and ambiance. Where other games rely on jump-scares or pitch black environments all of the time, Half-Life gives those elements to you in doses small enough that they don’t become stale or overdone. The combat is also excellent, though the controls are a little loose by today’s standards. The game even does platforming and puzzling well. Overall, the game is a must-own for any FPS fan, and even one for those not as FPS-inclined.

[h1]O melhor jogo da minha vida[/h1]
Meu pai me apresentou esse jogo quando eu era pequeno... Eu ganhei um CD original do jogo, a "edição especial", WON, que vinha com o incrível Team Fortress Classic. Tinha um menu badass, todo animado, lindo e nostálgico.

Me perdia jogando Mods e partidas contra bots... Era simplesmente fantástico! Eu tinha que zerar pelo menos uma vez na semana pra completar a cota a outra metade da vida.

O jogo é bem antigo, mas sem dúvidas continua sendo um clássico que qualquer amante de FPS em geral precisa jogar.

Eu não vou nem dar meus pontos negativos ou positivos, mas sim abordar cada coisa no geral.

[h1]História do jogo[/h1]
Basicamente: Tu é o Gordon Freeman, o f0daum mestre com qualquer arma. Você chega atrasado ao seu trabalho, algo de grande importância aconteceria nesse dia, e Gordon não podia perder tempo.

Você sai do trem, conversa com os personagens, pega seu H.E.V. e vai até o local de destino. Durante o percurso, Gordon percebe os perigos com a execução do teste nesse dia. Vários equipamentos danificados, máquinas sendo puxadas além do limite, a teoria de uma ressonância em cascata estava preocupando cada vez mais seus colegas de trabalho.

Como um bom profissional, Gordon entra na câmara de testes, e aguarda as instruções. Durante o teste, os cientistas avisam sobre a sobrecarga dos equipamentos, e notam uma certa discrepância acontecendo com os equipamentos, mas decidem continuar.

Um carrinho com um estranho cristal é entregue, e é dado a instrução para que empurre-o até os lasers do equipamento de testes. E não podia acontecer algo diferente... Uma tempestade de portais acontece ao redor de Black Mesa, e estranhas e agressivas criaturas começam a aparecer em todo os lugares, matando ou controlando qualquer humano encontrado ali.

Seu novo objetivo é descobrir o que está acontecendo, encontrando vários de seus colegas mortos ou extremamente feridos ao seu redor. Confuso e com medo, Gordon continua sua jornada em busca de ajuda, e, consequentemente, de respostas, e dos culpados por isso tudo. 

[h1]O quão divertido é[/h1]
O bom desse jogo é que você SEMPRE está no controle, sua sobrevivência depende apenas de você. Bom ou Mal? É sua escolha. Matar todos ou aproveitar de suas habilidades para continuar, é você quem decide. Matar ou morrer...

Meu bom jovem, quando você conseguir a escopeta, sua vida estará completa. Pura matança frenética, com aquela trilha sonora tocando ao fundo, explosões pra tudo quanto é lado. O chato mesmo é ter que esperar o longo percurso de trem atéééé chegar ao objetivo atual.

Possui vários ambientes diferentes: Laboratórios, túneis, tremzin subterrâneo, desertos, mundos alienígenas.

Várias armas, desde o arsenal básico como pistolas, escopetas e metralhadoras, até os fantásticos gauss, crossbow, hornet, mas a melhor arma de todas: Snarks. Mortais, bonitinhos e perigosos, essas tralhas vão comer teu rabo.

Namoral... Pular em um tanque e ficar dançando pra lá e pra cá, bugar as torres, pular em cima dos soldados com o crowbar, ficar só no bhop e passar varado pelos monstros, escalar tripmines, surfar em montanhas, desarmar minas, explodir helicópteros... Aliste-se na junta mais próxima, não perca tempo, soldado!

[h1]Os incríveis Mods[/h1]
Esse jogo tem muito mod, muito mod bom... Namoral, vá ao site MODDB por exemplo e pesquise mods como: Brutal Half-Life, POV, Sandpit, Sweet HL1... Mods incríveis, cada um com sua peculiaridade, e principalmente, divertidíssimos!!!

Sem dúvidas, a comunidade é que está mantendo o jogo vivo até hoje. Jogos como o Sven-Coop e Black Mesa estão fazendo um ótimo trabalho nesse quesito. Sério, pesquise por esses dois no Steam, não vai se arrepender...

Half-Life. Ну давайте поговорим о Half-Life. Я не знаю с чего начать, так что сначала пусть будет немного истории.

Главное достоинство игры - второй переворот[1] представления о играх у простого народа, если такие игры как Quake или Rise of Triad заложили PC как игровую платформу[2] в лице офисного планктона, то такие игры как Blood или Unreal шептали нам о скорой революции видеоигр; ей стала Half-Life, и в итоге утвердила PC как игровую платформу. По сути своей, идея Half-Life лежала в сильном погружении в мир игры посредством хорошей подачи сюжета, которая и стала единственным новаторством как в своем жанре, так и в видеоиграх в принципе. Играя в Half-Life вы чувствуете весь дух рассыпающегося на глазах лабораторного комплекса, чувствуете на себе весь ужас происходящего и будете хотеть выбраться на поверхность, чувствуете мрак, что потихоньку затмевает всякие ценности и принципы. Игра в роде Half-Life могла возникнуть и раньше, тот же самый Quake вышел очередной забавой для офисного планктона, однако на его же модифицированной версии движка был создан Half-Life. ID Software - дети с невероятной технологией, более того - лидером - Кармаком, не признающим игры как некое слияние искусств, отчего Valve смогли их опередить и весьма удачно. Хотя, ранние презентации Half-Life на E3 показывали Half-Life почти в том же самом свете, что и Quake II, но в любом случае, с лучшим дизайном и атмосферой чем у ее конкурентов.

Сюжет повествует о физике-теоретике Гордоне Фримане, который работает в научном исследовательском комплексе Черная Меза. Ученые совершают открытие: им удается попасть в промежуточный между остальными мирами мир "Зэн", полный как диких животных, так и разумных существ, которые испытывают явное недовольство ко вторжению в их мир землян. Итог открытия: бурные исследования; в процессе одного из них мы и должны участвовать.

Согласитесь, что тут сюжет явно не для оправдания действий игрока, как во всех шутерах до Half-Life, тут он держит вас в напряжении всю игру наряду с другими аспектами вроде атмосферы.

Теперь разговор пойдет о самой игре. Пожалуй, без сомнений главной особенностью игры является подача сюжета. Здесь он подается не в виде текста между уровнями, не в виде катсцен[3], не в виде видеороликов, не в виде гайда на официальном сайте или в руководстве к игре, а прямо по ходу игры. Игрок не теряет контроль над главным героем[4]; все продвижения по сюжету происходят прямо у него на глазах: тут он запускает ракету, тут он получает от ученого сообщение, что надо двигать в сектор Лямбда, чтобы было ништяково, и т.п.;

Вторая же главная особенность игры заключается в неповторимом дизайне: какой бы вы уровень не взяли, он сделан шикарно: даже в самом начале игры вам демонстрируют результат пары бессонных ночей, не говоря уже о пограничном мире, вундервафлях и всей лаборатории в целом. А раз речь зашла о вундервафлях, то непременно нужно упомянуть арсенал главного героя, а он весьма калоритный: помимо стандартного набора из холодного оружия, пистолета, автомата, дробовика, ракетницы, гранат, есть уникальные образцы: тау-пушка, что разогревая уран бьет с такой отдачей, что можно отлететь со скоростью, чуть ли не соника; снарки, или в простонародье жуки: противные красные клопы с зубами из Зэна, которых можно кидать во врагов и наблюдать дивный пир; ну и конечно же всеми любимый глюонный дестабилизатор, то бишь пылесос, превращающий всех и вся в котлеты. Не секрет, что стрелять в Half-Life одно удовольствие. Противники же и вовсе радуют глаз: на потолках обосновываются барнаклы (желудки с длинным втягивающим языком); по всем коридорам прыгают хэдкрабы, превращающие людей в зомби; подоспевшие к зачистке монстров и персонала военные; двуногие быки-осьминоги; плотоядные пиявки; всем полюбившиеся вортигонты, исполняющие роль разведчиков или типа того; те же самые снарки не менее доставляют своим видом и повадками.

Геймплей состоит в отстреливании групп противников и продвижении по разрушающемуся комплексу в надежде спастись; простенько и со вкусом. Чем это сопровождается, я вроде бы уже сказал: прекрасный дизайн, подача сюжета, все это здорово гармонирует между собой, держа игрока в напряжении всю игру.

Примечания:

1. Первый переворот случился в 1985 году, после выхода Super Mario Bros. Игра ушла от аркады в сторону игр на прохождение. Таким образом, при слове "Игра" среднестатистический человек представил бы себе стандартный для нас сейчас платформер вместо "игры на рекорд" -  аркады.

2. Игровой платформой считали Sega Saturn, Panasonic 3DO, Nintendo 64 и прочие игровые консоли, в серьез PC вряд ли можно было бы взять, по крайней мере до 1996-1998 годов.

3. Всего одна катсцена за всю игру, и то продолжительностью в 35 секунд.

4. За исключением единственной за всю игру катсцены в 35 секунд.

There isn't much to say about this gem that hasn't already been said. You've clearly heard of it, and you've heard its praise. It's all true. Everything that is said to be so great and revolutionary is indeed exactly as it is made out to be. If you would consider yourself a collector of artifacts that shaped the industry, you need Half-Life. But, it is not exclusive to these people. The only things that haven't aged well are the graphics, but perhaps you can find nostalgia through walking in its grim, pixelated maps of the 90s. Any regular gamer can play it, if they seek to know why it is so highly praised.

I'll try not to spoil too much, but perhaps you already know how it ends if you've played sequels as well. It makes itself known that it is its own self, it has its own identification with all the elements that build it, and it is damn proud of itself. To name an important one: the atmosphere. The atmosphere is that of a haunting dread creeping up your spine and over your shoulders. The game shows you early on that it gives no mercy to whoever it pleases, and many won't seem to have a happy ending. This could have gone quite wrong, and felt like you were being dragged along to your doom, but it doesn't. Instead, it feels like a struggle, because although you may be strained by the persistent obstacles, both living and inanimate, each new chapter you pass and each round of enemies you eliminate makes you feel great, and often like a hero. Yet, if one were to describe the overall experience in just a few words: brutal, bleak, and badass. And one more thing to mention of the atmosphere is that there seems to be a thin blanket of horror covering it. Enemies of disgusting caricatures will jump at you from the dark corners and hidden spaces, or you will not be their victim, but instead a spectator to them mauling an innocent ally, where you can do nothing to help. Often, its not the enemies that are so eerie, but the silence itself. I caught myself with a piqued interest and a bit of relief each time I met a new group of scientists, or, creatures that wouldn't actually kill me. You may feel lonely and jumpy as you walk through the complex maps, until something is trying to kill you yet again. Maybe this wouldn't appeal to many, but to me it does, and the game does a fantastic job at being itself, as I mentioned earlier. 

The atmosphere helps tremendously to build the story, and a great story it is. It's the classic trope of aliens invading earth, but its the humans' fault this time. It could have been a very simple and cliched one, but once you begin to dive further into game, it becomes special in its own way, with special characters and backstories, strange and ambiguous anomalies that taunt you. That's about as much as I can say without spoiling anything, I feel. It's another aspect that makes Half-Life what it is.

Another element are the combat mechanics, because it's clearly a shooter. Guns pack a serious punch and crack at enemies (although it only feels this way, because you never truly feel overpowered), and the feeling of shotgunning a vortigaunt in the face, or pummeling a headcrab mid-air with your trusty crowbar is so satisfying. Enemies also fight back with variety. Some are slow tanks, others are glass cannons, others white mages, and others are independent enough that they will attack both you and your enemies.

I think I've mentioned a bit of every important point that makes the game so great. I just have one small tip left for newcomers: don't be afraid to consult a guide, because the maps are wide, with many levels and hallways that you will need to traverse, where you can get lost quite easily if you aren't used to these types of maps.

This is a game from a time when Valve were just a small group of ambitious developers who played a lot of Quake. I'll spare you the read because we've all heard about what makes Half-life so great before, the fluid combination of gameplay that still manages to carry along a half decent narrative, the iconic design of the environments and enemies, being able to play as a character who isn't some tanked up super soldier, but a guy who's about to have a shit day at work. Like I said, this game came from a time when Valve didn't have money spewing at them from Dota, TF2 hat skins and steam sales. But it's a game that did what it did so well that, without it, Valve would probably just be some group of no name developers. It isn't perfect, the voice acting is cheesy, the characters feel like robots, their are a few weapons that are kind of useless (mainly the snarks and satchel charges), the graphics look like origami, but it has this distinct charm and simplicity to it that just has no substitute. It takes me back to a much simpler time when Valve wasn't the machine that powered the commercial games industry.

通关时间：23小时。晚上一个人玩的话氛围还是有点吓人的。流程相当长，玩起来也是累得不行，还经常因为找不到路卡关。
有些关卡略难，对手残党不太友好。即使是简单难度，我还是在游戏中挂了上百次。
可玩性在当时的作品里算是一流，不过还是有些小bug影响体验：
-标题画面全屏时无法切出
-准星颜色和背景色太过接近且不能更改（而且准星太小）
-切手雷时没准星
-推/拉箱子操作性极烂
-远距离跳跃操作太复杂（我就是手残，没办法。让一个连跳蹲都做不好的手残做这种动作，实在有点勉为其难）
-在水中没有氧气含量表
-AI扔手雷太准（不是我找借口，他们真的很熟练）
-队友经常走丢
-对非人形目标的伤害判定比较迷（比如一辆坦克，有时候5个手雷能炸掉，有时候却要10个）
-用撬棍对不可破坏的玻璃的打击音效和用枪是一样的
-手电筒太过节能
-遥控炸弹一次只能放并引爆一个，不能全部放出再一起引爆（这样不仅科学而且游戏难度会下降很多）
-对游戏中获得的新武器没有任何使用说明（我是说那些个看起来像是生物的东西……还有就是直到游戏最后我才发现散弹枪按鼠标右键可以一次双发）
-boss级别的怪物、坦克、碉堡之类的都没有血条，（这严重打击了我的战斗欲望，甚至怀疑这些怪其实是“immortal”而因此去尝试躲开它的攻击）……有些目标则确实是无法被摧毁的，游戏中也没有任何相应的提醒，白白浪费我子弹

在结局时，弗里曼做出了选择，bgm响起，然后……
黑屏了（只有按空格键有反应，此时会播放出脚步声的音效）
↑这是游戏的bug吧？难道就这么完了？↑


但，这依旧是部优秀的作品，的确无愧为经典

至于剧情……虽然外界的评价很高，不过我被这马拉松式的游戏流程剥削掉了大部分的精神力，已经几乎无暇顾及
但另一方面也说明了我中毒太深，忍不住在通过一关后接着玩下一关的欲望……

What can I say? This game is fantastic! A revolutionnary game, from its time, and still has its remains today! I have spent many hours playing and re-playing the game countless times. The more I play it, the more of a blast it is to play again! You cannot get bored of this game, and if you somehow haven't already, I highly recommend that you buy it, or at least try it out somehow. The sounds and textures, whilst some have been high definitionned, they are still quite primitive but somehow have an artistic feel to them, as does the rest of the game.

In the game, you are Gordon Freeman. No, you're not playing as him, he's almost like playing as you. You control everything that character does. There are no cutscenes, and instead everything is done by hadn. In fact, you can kill your allies if you want to, or kill the aliens if you prefer as well as the military that hunts you down. The game is such an emotional rollercoaster. When you get up into the outside world, the sun brightens your eyes and dopamine fills your heart, but then you have to go back down again with no choice but to face your fears, getting lost in Black Mesa.

You don't need to play this game. In fact, you can perfectly play Half Life 2 without playing this game without revealing anything of importance. But if you get the chance to, please do. The base, vanilla game and its extensions are fabulous already, but imagine if it was even better. Yes. There are countless mods, all filled with fun and action, that will put you for 10s of 100s of hours even, having fun with this wonder of a community-reawoken game.

I highly recommend it. Now you don't have to buy it. How could I force you? But I say, you are missing out if you don't buy it, but it is ultimately your choice.
